de.humatic.dsj.rc

Class EVRControls

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.humatic.dsj.rc.RendererControls
      • de.humatic.dsj.rc.DSRendererControls
        • de.humatic.dsj.rc.EVRControls

  • public class EVRControls
extends DSRendererControls
    Provides additional control and image overlay functionality for the Enhanced Video Renderer (EVR). An application gets hold of this object by calling getRendererControl() on a DSFiltergraph object that has been set up with the EVR flag.
    By default the EVR offers a single video channel plus static graphics overlay. You can extend the number of video streams by setting a preference named "EVR_Inputs" using DSEnvironment.storePreference(...);
    Video inputs should not be used for still images.
    Note that the EVR is only available on Vista and beyond and there are currently no ways to make it update control or overlay changes when the filtergraph is paused or stopped.

      • getVProcAmpRanges

      • setContrast

        public void setContrast(int streamID,
               float value)
                 throws DSJException
        VProcAmp control. Value should be in the valid range as returned by getVProcAmpRanges(property). The streamID parameter is currently ignored, settings will affect all video streams.

        DSJException

        public void setAlpha(int streamID,
            float alpha)
              throws DSJException
        Sets the alpha blending level (0 - fully transparent, 1.0 - fully opaque) for an eventual image overlay. The streamID parameter is currently ignored, settings will only affect the still layer.

        DSJException

      • setRenderingPrefs

        public void setRenderingPrefs(int prefs)
                       throws DSJException
        Sets EVR rendering preferences. Takes a bitwise OR combination of RP_... constants. Most of these are only supported on Windows 7, see msdn documentation for IMFVideoRenderPrefs.
        Throws:
        DSJException

      • getRenderingPrefs

        public int getRenderingPrefs()
        Returns current mixing preferences (bitwise combination of MixerPref9 flags)

      • setAspectRatioMode

        public void setAspectRatioMode(int mode)
                        throws DSJException
        Sets EVR aspect ratio handling. As this method only affects the native DirectShow filter you may need to also call DSFiltergraph.lockAspectRatio(..) along with it.
        Throws:
        DSJException

      • getAspectRatioMode

        public int getAspectRatioMode()
        Returns currently set aspect ratio handling.

      • setOverlayImage

        public boolean setOverlayImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                      int[] dest,
                      java.awt.Color keyColor,
                      float alpha)
                        throws DSJException
        Renders a static image overlay on top of video.
        The supplied image MUST be a 32 bit image with alpha channel (use BufferedImage.TYPE_4BYTE_ABGR when constructing the image in code (preferred) or .png when reading from image file,). All pixels in %image whose RGB value meets %colorKey will be transparent in the resulting composition regardless of overall alpha setting via %alpha.
        %alpha takes values between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque).
        To remove the overlay call this method with the image parameter set to null.
        Overrides:
        setOverlayImage in class RendererControls
        Throws:
        DSJException
